Class Company

java.lang.Object
Company
public class Company
extends java.lang.Object
The Company class stores a list of Employees in an array and provides functions to add, remove, find, set hours and process payments. Other functions include printing employees in order by date / department. Also there are helper methods that are referenced throughout the PayrollProcessing class.
Author:
Abimanyu Ananthu, Ashish Shenoy

    private Employee[] emplist

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Company()
    Creates a Company and starts off with memory to store 4 employees.

    Method to print all the employees in the company, by their departments.
    void processPayments()
    Method to process all payments in the company, uses calculatePayments which will perform the correct calculation due to polymorphism.

    Method to remove a specified employee from the company.
    boolean setHours​(Employee employee)
    Method to set the hours that a specific part time employee has worked.

  • Constructor Details

    • Company

      public Company()
      Creates a Company and starts off with memory to store 4 employees.

  • Method Details

    • find

      private int find​(Employee employee)
      A helper method to check to see and find a employee in the employee list.
      Parameters:
      employee - the Employee we are looking for.
      Returns:
      index of the employee if found, otherwise return -1 if the employee is not in the employee list.

    • grow

      private void grow()
      A helper method to grow the employee list by 4 indexes once the employee list is full. An employee list always starts with space to store 4 employees and expands as more employees are added to the list.

    • add

      public boolean add​(Employee employee)
      Method to add a specified employee to the employee list.
      Parameters:
      employee - the Employee we are adding to the employee list.
      Returns:
      A boolean value showing if the employee was placed in the list. True if the employee was successfully placed, false otherwise.

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(Employee employee)
      Method to remove a specified employee from the company.
      Parameters:
      employee - the employee we are removing to the company.
      Returns:
      returns true if the employee was removed, otherwise false in the case the employee is not able to be removed because they are not in the company.

    • setHours

      public boolean setHours​(Employee employee)
      Method to set the hours that a specific part time employee has worked. This method is will return false if the employee is not part time.
      Parameters:
      employee - the employee that will be working for __ hours. We specify the amount of hours worked for withing the PayrollProcess class.
      Returns:
      returns true if the employee was able to have their hours set. Returns false if the employee was not found or not part time.

    • getNumEmployee

      public int getNumEmployee()
      Returns the number of employees currently in the company.
      Returns:
      An int value representing the # of employees in the company.

    • processPayments

      public void processPayments()
      Method to process all payments in the company, uses calculatePayments which will perform the correct calculation due to polymorphism.

    • print

      public void print()
      Method to print all the employees in the company.

    • printByDepartment

      public void printByDepartment()
      Method to print all the employees in the company, by their departments.

    • printByDate

      public void printByDate()
      Method to print all the employees in the company, in ascending date order.

    • sortByDate

      private void sortByDate()
      Helper method to sort the employees in ascending date order, using selection sort.

    • sortByDepartment

      private void sortByDepartment()
      Helper method to sort the employees by department. CS employees are at the front, ECE employees in the middle and IT employees are at the end. Uses selection sort.
